Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Gyros

Class BaseGyro

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Gyros.BaseGyro
public class BaseGyro extends Object
The BaseGyro class provides an abstraction for interacting with a gyro sensor. It communicates with the underlying GyroIO interface to retrieve and set orientation data (yaw, pitch, and roll) and periodically updates sensor inputs.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseGyro

      public BaseGyro(String name, GyroIO io)
      Constructor to initialize a BaseGyro instance.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the gyro sensor for identification.
      io - The GyroIO interface used to interact with the gyro hardware.

  • Method Details

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Periodically updates the sensor inputs from the GyroIO interface. This should be called regularly to refresh the gyro's data.

    • setYaw

      public void setYaw(double yaw)
      Sets the yaw value of the gyro sensor.
      Parameters:
      yaw - The desired yaw value to set.

    • setRoll

      public void setRoll(double roll)
      Sets the roll value of the gyro sensor.
      Parameters:
      roll - The desired roll value to set.

    • setPitch

      public void setPitch(double pitch)
      Sets the pitch value of the gyro sensor.
      Parameters:
      pitch - The desired pitch value to set.

    • getYaw

      public Rotation2d getYaw()
      Gets the current yaw position of the gyro as a Rotation2d object.
      Returns:
      The yaw position of the gyro.

    • getPitch

      public Rotation2d getPitch()
      Gets the current pitch position of the gyro as a Rotation2d object.
      Returns:
      The pitch position of the gyro.

    • getRoll

      public Rotation2d getRoll()
      Gets the current roll position of the gyro as a Rotation2d object.
      Returns:
      The roll position of the gyro.

    • getTimeDiff

      public double getTimeDiff()
      Retrieves the time difference between the last and current sensor update. This can be useful for determining how much time has passed between updates.
      Returns:
      The time difference between the last and current update in seconds.
